txt.en: 'I heard that you are heading east, towards the Kibil-nâla. I am Gori Stonesetter, Master Architect. An ancestor of mine worked to build bridges and buildings about the valley in ages past, when Khazad-dûm was still ours.\n\n'I wish to examine the nearby ruins, but I need someone with a strong arm to mind my back. If you are of a mind to help, I would greatly appreciate it.'
Talk to Gori to travel to the ruins
'Let us travel the old ways of our forefathers!'
Gori Stonesetter wishes to walk among the ruins his ancestors built ages past.
Gori Stonesetter can be found in Amdân.\n\nGori has asked you to accompany him to the bridge that crosses the Kibil-nâla.
Gori Stonesetter can be found in Amdân.\n\nGori has asked you to talk with him in Amdân.

'Long have I desired to stand under those arches, and on those bridges. You have given me a wonderful gift on this day, my friend. You have my thanks.\n\n'There is much work to be done, but first this damnable war must be won. Let us hope that the damage from the conflicts to come are minimum. We have much to learn from those who built before.'
